content: Even though he sees it coming, there's not much he can do to stop the pummeling from happening. With a single open palm across the face he falls forward, flattened.
[hakon] Each day we wait means more dredge. Or another ambush, or we get snowed in.
[hakon] Maybe they knew something about what's happening. If he's going to tell us anything we need to get out of here alive.
[hakon] Maybe they knew something about what's happening. If he's going to tell us anything we need to get out of here alive.

content.option: Let's go
But first we need rest

content: [hakon mogr] Any options?
[hakon] That raises more questions than it answers.
[hakon] Tie him up. I don't want to see or hear him again until we get to Grofheim.
[hakon] What's going on?
/=Ludin barely keeps himself in check. If it were any colder you'd be able to see the steam rising from his head as he stomps toward his fighters.=/
[ludin] Good. That wasn't so hard, was it?
[ludin hakon] That's right, I knew his look was familiar.
[ludin hakon] What of it?
[ludin] I agree for once. I don't have any intention of staying here.
[ludin] I am the reasonable one! You want to wait until there's no chance of escape? I won't!
[ludin] If you've still got any sense we'll get out now before they bury the rest of us.
[ludin] If you've still got any sense we'll get out now before they bury the rest of us.

content.option: Ok. Let's prepare to fight
I disagree. We need rest if we're going to make it out of this.
Shall I have varl carry you on their shoulders as well?

content: [ludin] I'm leaving! Freeze to death in this tomb if you like.
[ludin] I'm leaving! Freeze to death in this tomb if you like.

content.option: "Go, then."
"Be reasonable for once, Ludin."
Knock him out

content: [ludin mogr] Each day we wait here the dredge are going to pile up. How many will there be tomorrow? Double? What about the next day?
[ludin] Now you consult me? Take a running leap from the tower, Hakon, I could not care.
/=Ludin's face becomes a singular deep scowl.=/
[ludin] That's the worth of my opinion, isn't it? You had already decided what you were going to do. Any opportunity to insult me.
[ludin] What difference does it make? We're all going to die here.
[ludin] You want my opinion? How unexpected. I think there's no point in waiting. Let the wounded ones fall behind.
[mogr] Alright. I'll spread the word and meet you back here soon.
/=Mogr bites his tongue. You have a bad feeling about what is going to happen next.=/
[mogr] But it's a lot. If we're getting back across the bridge it'll be a fight.
[mogr] Dammit, Hakon! This won't make things any easier. Now we've got two unconscious bodies to carry out of here.
[mogr] Er. Look, it's your call Hakon, but... we can't cut and run on this one. There's one way out.
[mogr hakon] If varl fall... if /=anyone=/ falls fighting here, they'll be left behind.

content.option: I'll take that risk. Let's make a plan.
We wait for now. Let's make this place defensible.
Ludin, what would you do?
We wait for now. Let's make this place defensible.
We wait for now. Let's make this place defensible
Ludin, what do you want to do?

content: [mogr hakon] I think he's really going to try it. Do we let him?

content.option: We're leaving, too. Just wanted to show him who's in charge.
Let's see how he does.
Bastard can jump from the tower for all I care.

content: [mogr hakon] The spell weavers? In Ridgehorn? Why?
[mogr hakon] We rest, then?

content.option: No, we've got to go. Ready the warriors.
Sure, Mogr. We'll rest.

content: [mogr] Hold on, we've got a lot of tired and wounded, Hakon. This is going to be rough.
[mogr] I agree. Let's decide how we're going to defend this dump in case they attack again.
[mogr] I don't like it, Hakon. That's all I'm going to say.
[mogr] If varl fall... if /=anyone=/ falls fighting here, they'll be left behind.
[mogr] If we're doing this now we need an approach. We can't just go up there swinging.
[mogr] I'll get the varl on their feet. Just don't let that idiot leave before we're ready.
[mogr] I think he's really going to try it. Do we let him?
[mogr] Not really. Unless you want to wade into that valley we're going to have to leave the same way we came in.
[mogr] Should I assume we're staying for now?

content.option: No, I just couldn't stand to listen to him anymore. We're leaving.
Only until we're ready for a fight.

content: [mogr] We rest, then?
[narrator] Can't tell how many more are waiting out there.
[narrator hakon] A heavy snow may act in our favor if we can get past the first line of dredge and lose the rest.
[narrator] Hakon, I think you should take a look at this.
[narrator] I had one eye on the fight... next time I looked down dredge were swarming into the courtyard.
[narrator] I think this man is a mender.
[narrator mogr] Someone should say it. The longer we stay, the more dredge will be waiting for us, and the worse the weather. Maybe we should go now.
[narrator] Temper your pride, Hakon. It won't be worth a damn in the grave.
/=Nearby, the man had been bundled and laid near a short wall protected from the wind.=/
{skip}
{skip} mark1=hakon mark2=narrator mark3=mogr mark4=ludin

content.option: {skip}

content: /=The courtyard goes silent, as you recall his recent loss. Mogr coughs.=/
